ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
Assessment type
Notes: 1=TADS GATE A; 2=TADS GATE B; 3 = TADS Gate C; 4 = TADS Week 6; 5 = TADS Week 12; 6 = TADS Week 18; 7 = TADS Week 24; 8 = TADS Week 30; 9 = TADS Week 36; 10 = TADS F/U Mo 3; 11 = TADS F/U Mo 6; 12 = TADS F/U Mo 9; 13 = TADS F/U Mo 12; 14 = SOFTAD month 6; 15 = SOFTAD month 12; 16 = SOFTAD month 18; 17 = SOFTAD month 24; 18 = SOFTAD month 30; 19 = SOFTAD month 36; 20 = SOFTAD month 42

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Weeks from Time 0/baseline to assessment
Months from Time 0 to assessment
Months from SOFTAD enrollment date to assessment
Have you started smoking or using tobacco products since your last TADS or SOFTAD study visit?
Have you quit since your last TADS or SOFTAD study visit?
Smoking or tobacco use history
Notes: 1 = Never used, not even a single puff2 = Smoked once or twice, but not in the last month3 = Do not smoke, but in the past I was a regular smoker4 = Smoked regularly but no more than once a month5 = Smoked regularly but no more than once a week6 = Smoked regularly and more than once a week; 7 = current smoker; 8 = Past Smoker

indicate the number of years that the participant has smoked cigarettes

During the past 30 days, on how many days did you smoke part or all of a cigarette? PX030801_30Day_Frequency_Count

Have you ever used any tobacco product such as cigarettes, cigars, tobacco pipe, chewing tobacco, snuff, e-cigarettes containing nicotine, nicotine chewing gum or a nicotine patch since last follow up?
Have you ever smoked cigarettes regularly for at least three months since last follow up? By "regularly" we mean at least 5 cigarettes per week almost every week.
Have you ever smoked cigars regularly for a least three months since last follow up? By "regularly" we mean at least 2 cigars per week almost every week.
Do you still smoke cigars regularly?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = No, but I still smoke cigars occasionally; 999 = Missing/Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Have you ever smoked a tobacco pipe regularly for at three months since last follow up? By "regularly" we mean at least 2 pipes full of tobacco a week almost every week.
Do you still smoke a pipe regularly?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = No, but I still smoke a pipe occasionally; 999 = Missing/Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Have you ever used smokeless tobacco such as snuff, chewing tobacco, other products such as "Skoal's Bandits" or e-cigarettes containing nicotine regularly for at least three months since last follow up? By "regularly" we mean at least once a week almost every week.
Do you still use smokeless tobacco regularly?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = No, but I still use smokeless tobacco occasionally; 999 = Missing/Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Have you ever used a nicotine gum such as "Nicorette" since last follow up?
Have you used nicotine gum in the past week?
Have you ever used a nicotine patch such as "Nicoderm" or "Habitrol" since last follow up?
Have you used a nicotine patch in the past week?
Not counting yourself, how many people do you live with that smoke cigarettes since last follow up?
Based on old COBY TOBACCO USE FORM definition, have you ever smoked cigarettes regularly since last follow up? By "regularly" we mean at least 1 cigarette a day or more for at least 30 days.
Based on old COBY TOBACCO USE FORM definition, what was your greatest amount of tobacco use since last follow up?
Do you still smoke cigarettes regularly? By "regularly" we mean at least 5 cigarettes per week almost every week.
Have you started smoking regularly in the last three months? By "regularly" we mean at least 5 cigarettes per week almost every week.
Have you made any attempts to stop smoking cigarettes in the past five years?
How many of these attempts to stop smoking lasted 48 hours or more?
Do you plan to make any of these changes in your smoking in the next six months? - Quit completely?
Do you plan to make any of these changes in your smoking in the next six months? - Cut down on number of cigarettes smoked?
Do you plan to make any of these changes in your smoking in the next six months? - Change to lower "tar" or nicotine cigarette?
On a scale of 0 to 10, where 0 means not at all interested in quitting and 10 means very interested in quitting, how interested are you in quitting smoking?
Notes: 0 = Not at all interested in quitting; 10 = Very interested in quitting; 999 = Missing/Not Applicable
